sections.title: Syntax
sections.text_content: Pic.New (x1, y1, x2, y2 : int) : int

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
Pic.New is used to obtain a picture of a portion of the screen. The Pic.New procedure allocates the memory for the picture, which can be very large for pictures of large areas. The memory is freed up when the program calls Pic.Free with the picture ID. The picture can be used with the Pic.Draw and Pic.Save.

The picture is of the screen area defined by the rectangle (x1, y1) - (x2, y2).
sections.text_content:
Pic.New is used to obtain a picture of a portion of the 
          screen. The Pic.New procedure allocates the memory for 
	  the picture, which can be very large for pictures of large areas.
	  The memory is freed up when the program calls Pic.Free with 
	  the picture ID. The picture can be used with the Pic.Draw 
	  and Pic.Save.
	  The picture is of the screen area defined by the rectangle 
	  (x1, y1) - (x2, y2).
sections.mdown_content:
**Pic.New** is used to obtain a picture of a portion of the screen. The **Pic.New** procedure allocates the memory for the picture, which can be very large for pictures of large areas.The memory is freed up when the program calls **Pic.Free** with the picture ID. The picture can be used with the **Pic.Draw** and **Pic.Save**.
The picture is of the screen area defined by the rectangle (*x1*, *y1*) - (*x2*, *y2*).

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: If the Pic.New call fails, then it returns 0. Also Error.Last will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. Error.LastMsg will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.
sections.text_content:
If the Pic.New call fails, then it returns 0. Also 
          Error.Last will return a non-zero value indicating the 
	  reason for the failure. Error.LastMsg will return a string 
	  which contains the textual version of the error.
sections.mdown_content: If the **Pic.New** call fails, then it returns 0. Also **Error.Last** will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. **Error.LastMsg** will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.

sections.title: Example
code:
var picID: int
        var x, y : int
        Draw.FillBox (50, 50, 150, 150, red)
        Draw.FillStar (50, 50, 150, 150, green)
        Draw.FillOval (100, 100, 30, 30, blue)
        
        picID := Pic.New (50, 50, 150, 150)
        for i : 1 .. 50
            x := Rand.Int (0, maxx)     % Random x
            y := Rand.Int (0, maxy)     % Random y
            Pic.Draw (picID, x, y, picCopy)
        end for
        Pic.Free (picID)
sections.raw_content: The program draws a graphic on the screen and then draws it 50 times.
sections.text_content: The program draws a graphic on the screen and then draws it 50 times.
sections.mdown_content: The program draws a graphic on the screen and then draws it 50 times.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Pic.New, not by calling New.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
	  This means that you can only call the function by calling 
	  Pic.New, not by calling New.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Pic.New**, not by calling **New**.
